intro: Teucrium × coeleste nothosubsp. coeleste, commonly known as blue germander, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers and aromatic, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is native to Europe and has been cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and ecological landscapes.
